title: Product Manager Digital Transformation of Funding
description:
Why Join Us?
We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.  

At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.  

As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to grow ideas in an unconventional environment. At the same time, you’ll work in a culture of ongoing learning and development, allowing you to constantly expand your area of expertise.
We are seeking a Product Manager to lead the digital transformation of our funding operations – a multi-year, multi-million SEK initiative that will fundamentally reshape how we serve our customers. With 75% of our business flowing through the funding process, this transformation is critical to our continued growth and success. As our business scales rapidly, our legacy systems (developed 2011-2017) can no longer support current volumes and complexity. This role will drive the modernization of our funding processes through three strategic pillars: digitalization of data, processes, and communication.  

You'll own the product vision for transforming our funding ecosystem from manual, paper-based workflows to AI-enhanced, digital-first experiences that serve customers, funding consultants, Speech-Language Pathologists, and physicians. This includes both modernizing existing capabilities and developing entirely new solutions that reimagine how funding operations could work.  

What You'll Do
Strategic Product Leadership* Define and execute the product roadmap for our Digital Transformation Initiative
* Translate complex funding domain requirements into clear product specifications for development teams
* Balance stakeholder needs across customers, internal funding team, SLPs, physicians, and insurance payers
* Drive user-centered design thinking to challenge existing processes and identify optimization opportunities
* Lead both incremental system improvements and greenfield product development initiatives
* Re-engineer processes from the ground up rather than simply digitizing existing workflows
  

Cross-Functional Collaboration* Partner with diverse development teams to deliver solutions ranging from system enhancements to completely new platforms
* Work with funding operations experts to understand insurance requirements, state-by-state variations, and regulatory compliance needs
* Coordinate with change management teams to ensure successful user adoption across all stakeholder groups
* Collaborate with external partners and vendors on innovative solutions that transcend current organizational constraints
* Manage development initiatives that require creative freedom to reimagine processes rather than replicate existing systems
  

Product Development & Delivery* Lead requirements gathering through user research, process mapping, and stakeholder interviews
* Manage feature prioritization and scope decisions across the transformation roadmap
* Oversee UX/UI design processes to ensure intuitive and mobile-responsive experiences
* Drive development of AI-enhanced capabilities including OCR document processing and automated eligibility verification
* Ensure data quality, security, and compliance throughout all solutions
  

User Experience & Adoption* Champion the customer experience from initial application through device delivery
* Design digital-first processes that reduce manual work and processing times
* Create seamless experiences for funding consultants using new case management tools
* Develop enhanced tools for SLPs and streamlined capabilities for physician interactions
  

Your Impact
This transformation will modernize our funding operations through digitalization of data, processes, and communication. You'll lead the development of AI-enhanced automation, payer system integrations, and comprehensive case management solutions that will fundamentally change how we serve our customers and scale our operations.  

What You Bring
Required Experience* 3-5 years of product management experience, preferably with internal tools or B2B solutions
* Proven track record of leading cross-functional teams through complex system transformations
* Experience with both incremental system improvements and greenfield product development
* Strong analytical skills with ability to translate business processes into technical requirements
* Background in user research, requirements gathering, and stakeholder management
* Demonstrated ability to re-engineer processes rather than simply digitize existing workflows
  

Preferred Qualifications* Experience in healthcare, insurance, government, or other administratively complex/regulated industries
* Familiarity with DME, AAC, or assistive technology markets
* Knowledge of insurance reimbursement processes or payer integrations
* Experience with AI/ML integration in business applications
* Background in process improvement or operational efficiency initiatives
  

Essential Skills* Process thinking: Ability to map complex workflows and reimagine them from first principles
* User empathy: Deep focus on understanding and solving real user problems
* Technical collaboration: Comfortable working with diverse development teams and technology approaches
* Change leadership: Experience driving adoption of entirely new tools and processes
* Communication: Clear, compelling storytelling to align diverse stakeholders
* Creative problem-solving: Ability to design solutions unconstrained by existing system limitations
* Adaptability: Comfortable working with varying levels of organizational context and development approaches
  

Why This Role Matters
This position sits at the intersection of technology and human impact. The funding transformation you'll lead directly affects families' access to life-changing communication devices. Your work will reduce administrative burden on our team, streamline experiences for customers navigating complex insurance processes, and enable Tobii Dynavox to scale our mission of giving people their voice.  

You'll have the opportunity to build something from the ground up, working with cutting-edge AI and integration technologies while solving real-world problems that matter. This is a rare chance to own the product vision for a comprehensive digital transformation with measurable business impact and meaningful human outcomes.
Apply today!
We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.
company_description: Tobii Dynavox’s mission is to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did, or never thought possible.

title: Power BI-konsult till offentlig sektor
description:
Soros Consulting söker nu en erfaren Power BI-konsult till ett uppdrag (4år) inom offentlig sektor. Uppdraget innebär att stärka verksamhetens förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut genom utveckling, vidareutveckling och förvaltning av rapporter och dashboards i Power BI.

Uppdragsgivaren har ett växande behov av att sammanställa och visualisera data från flera olika interna system samt externa källor. Informationen används som beslutsunderlag inom olika verksamhetsområden och är central i kvalitetsarbetet.

Som Power BI-konsult kommer du att arbeta nära verksamhetsutvecklare och bidra till att skapa effektiva, tillförlitliga och användarvänliga beslutsstöd.

Uppdragets omfattning

Utveckla nya Power BI-rapporter baserade på verksamhetsbehov

Vidareutveckla och förbättra befintliga rapporter

Reparera befintliga rapporter och lösa tekniska problem

Hämta och bearbeta data via API:er

Arbeta med större vidareutvecklingsinsatser i befintliga lösningar

Dokumentera lösningar och säkerställa datakvalitet

Genomföra tester och kvalitetssäkring

Bidra till kompetensöverföring inom verksamheten

Kvalifikationer

Skallkrav:

Dokumenterad erfarenhet av Power BI och Power Query

Kompetens inom data- och analysmodellering

Förmåga att designa, strukturera och underhålla datalager

Erfarenhet av att hantera personuppgifter enligt gällande regelverk

Goda kunskaper i Python (för att läsa, redigera och skapa script)

Erfarenhet av SQL för analys, felsökning, vyer och procedurer

Förståelse för arkitektur och best practices inom BI och rapportering

Kunskap om ETL-processer, UX-design för rapporter, samt arbete med API:er

Kunskap om Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse och Azure Data Factory

Meriterande (börkrav):

Erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig sektor

Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem, särskilt från Sokigo

Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga i tal och skrift

Förmåga att agera professionellt, förtroendeingivande och lyhört

God pedagogisk förmåga att förklara tekniska lösningar för icke-tekniska användare

Förmåga att snabbt förstå verksamhetsbehov och omsätta dessa i tekniska lösningar

Personliga egenskaper

Självständig och lösningsorienterad

Analytisk med förmåga att se samband och helhet

Strukturerad och noggrann i arbetet

Kommunikativ och pedagogisk

Leveransfokuserad med stark drivkraft

Vill du vara en del av ett uppdrag där du verkligen gör skillnad och får möjlighet att arbeta med modern BI-teknik i en verksamhet med stor samhällspåverkan?

Skicka din ansökan till Soros Consulting redan idag. Urval sker löpande.

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Arbetsort: På plats

title: Digital Experience Specialist
description:
We are now looking for a Digital Experience Specialist to take full ownership of our web platform and drive continuous improvement across content, design, conversion and user experience. This is a broad and hands-on role where you will work closely with marketing, product, tech and external partners, with real opportunity to shape how we work and grow with the business.
  
Get an idea of the role
  
  

You will be responsible for the day-to-day management and strategic development of our website across all four Nordic markets.
  
  

**Your main responsibilities will include:**  

Managing, updating and quality-assuring content in our CMS
  
Creating wireframes, clickable prototypes and user flows in collaboration with designers
  
Analyzing site traffic, user behavior and conversion
  
Driving improvements in UX and conversion flows based on insights
  
Collaborating with developers to implement changes and optimize performance
  
  

On a personal level
  
  

We are looking for someone who combines creativity with structure and is a true team player with a patient but proactive approach. You are confident in your skills, able to lead projects independently, and have a constant drive to improve.
  
  

**We believe you bring:**  

At least 1 year of experience in CRO, UX or digital optimization
  
Hands-on experience working with CMS (e.g. WordPress, Optimizely, Sitecore)
  
Solid understanding of Google Analytics 4, Tag Manager and other tracking tools
  
Ability to create wireframes and prototypes (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD or similar)
  
Practical knowledge of A/B testing tools like Google Optimize, VWO or similar is a plus
  
  

Resurs in brief
  
At Resurs, we make everyday finances easier through innovative and customer-focused solutions. With customers across the Nordics and more than 800 colleagues, we are committed to creating long-term value for individuals, businesses, and society. Recognized as a career company for the past six years, we put strong emphasis on both personal and professional growth. We want to make a difference by striving to be our best, acting with kindness, and building trust through clarity and collaboration. Our heart beats strong and it shows in everything we do.
  
Join an internationalteam
  
Although we are based in the Nordics, our team is enriched by the breadth of perspectives brought by colleagues from different countries. We foster a welcoming and supportive culture, where collaboration drives us to achieve the best outcomes for our users.
  
Apply today!
  
Don’t wait to send in your application. Selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the last application date.
  
We look forward to hearing from you!
  
Important information
  
On final candidates, we carry out a detailed background check via an external company.
  
* In this recruitment process, the supplier is solely responsible for the personal data they collect and process. Resurs is solely responsible for the personal data processed by us in the recruitment process. #LI-LN1

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Our team is on a mission to design great user experiences that help our over 2 million web customers create, configure, and develop their web presence.
  
  

We are looking for an experienced Digital Commerce Product Designer who has a solid understanding of e-commerce metrics to collaborate with our marketing leads in translating user needs and business ideas into outstanding landing pages, order and upselling/cross-selling flows, campaign concepts, and visual designs for our one.com brand.
  
As a passionate designer, you excel at transforming complex concepts into beautiful, simple, and user-friendly experiences. You inspire the organisation with insightful customer journeys, value propositions, and prototypes. Driven by data, you utilise market and user research methods such as interviews, surveys, usability tests, A/B tests and heatmaps to test and refine ideas both before and after implementation. This means that rather than being measured on the output of your design work, you are being measured on the success of your designs. As a true team player, you will work closely with our marketing, product, UX and design, and development teams. And, to our 32 passionate designers, you are a sparring partner who is inspiring, results-driven and keen to make a difference.
  
Qualifications 5+ years of experience in e-commerce, digital commerce, marketing, or agency settings
  
Degree in New Media Design, Visual Communication, Product Design, UX Design, or similar
  
Strong digital commerce-focused design portfolio with a mobile-first mindset, with expertise in designing for both mobile and desktop.
  
You can conduct data analysis, market, and user research to identify best practices and shape hypotheses on how best to address requirements.
  
Ability to translate user needs and business goals into clear, effective design
  
Skilled in user research, data analysis, customer journeys, and persona creation
  
Experience with tools like Maze, HotJar, Dovetail, Mixpanel, and Google Analytics
  
Advocate for user testing, customer centricity, and evidence-based design decisions
  
Comfortable collaborating across teams – from concept and ideation to implementation
  
You are effective in managing stakeholders. Engage and involve them from the beginning (research, strategy, concept) to the end (design and implementation).
  
Proficient in Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud
  
Familiar with working in Agile/Scrum teams and using design systems
  
High attention to detail and strong visual aesthetics
  
You provide and receive honest, valuable feedback.
  
  

You’re a curious, collaborative, and creative problem solver who enjoys turning complexity into clarity. You have a passion for beautiful, minimalist design and care deeply about creating meaningful user experiences. You’re confident in your craft, open to feedback, and thrive in a fast-moving, team-oriented environment. Most importantly, you want to make the web not just more usable — but more beautiful.
  
About usone.com is a part of group.one is a leading European provider of online presence, cloud hosting, and digital marketing services. Over 2 million customers trust us with their online success. Our global team consists of 1 500+ employees operating from nearly 20 locations across 15 countries, with our headquarters in Sweden. Thanks to the support of our partners Cinven and Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, we are steadily expanding the group's service portfolio and geographical footprint.
  
When you join group.one, you become a part of a global network that values collaboration, growth, and excellence. Join us in creating online success stories!
  
We don't care whether you are female, male or diverse, where you come from, how old you are, what colour your skin is or what you believe in. For us, the focus is on mutual respect, personal appreciation as well as fun and motivation at work. Develop yourself - your personality - because we focus on you as a person and team member.
  
We want to continue to grow with you. That's why we look forward to getting to know you.

title: Senior UX Designer till globalt techbolag!
description:
Är du en erfaren UX-designer som brinner för att skapa affärsdrivna digitala upplevelser? Till en av våra kunder i teknikbranschen söker vi nu en **Senior UX Designer** som vill ta en strategisk roll i ett engagerat designteam med stort inflytande på användarupplevelse och affärsutveckling.

### **Om rollen**


I den här rollen får du chansen att arbeta med både externa och interna digitala lösningar – allt från kommersiella webbplatser till interna plattformar och partnerverktyg. Fokus ligger på **att förbättra kundresor, driva engagemang och skapa lösningar som bidrar till affärsnytta**.


Du arbetar nära både utvecklingsteam, andra UX-designers och affärsstakeholders – i en miljö där samarbete och användarcentrering står i centrum.

### **Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**

* Ta fram och implementera UX-strategier kopplade till affärsmål

* Genomföra research och analyser av användarbeteenden

* Skapa kundresor och service blueprints för att identifiera förbättringsområden

* Designa användarvänliga gränssnitt för webblösningar

* Leda workshops och co-creation-sessioner med olika intressenter

* Coacha andra UX-designers i teamet och sprida din kompetens i organisationen


### **Vi söker dig som har:**

* 5+ års erfarenhet inom UX eller produktdesign

* Erfarenhet av att driva designprocesser från research till färdig lösning

* Van att arbeta strategiskt med UX kopplat till affärsmål

* Kompetens inom service design och customer journey mapping


-Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga

* Tidigare erfarenhet av större organisationer och gärna B2B

* *Meriterande:* Erfarenhet av agila team, responsiva webbapplikationer, marknadsföring och digitala plattformar

**Ansök direkt eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
**Assignment description**


Till vår kund söker vi en **Senior UX/UI Designer – med specialkompetens inom Designsystem.**

**Beskrivning av uppdraget:**


Uppdraget är att ta stort ansvar att driva i arbetet med att bygga upp ett designsystem från grunden tillsammans med ett tvärfunktionellt team med bland annat en fronendlead. I uppdraget ingår att både att jobba strategiskt med hur det ska byggas, vägval och hantering av stakeholders samt kommunikation och förankring/utbildning. Samt Samtidigt är lika mycket av uppdraget att arbeta ”hands-on” med att ta fram fungerande kvalitetssäkrade tillgängliga komponenter i Figma samt information kring själva designsystemet.


Leveransen är övergripande strategiskt samt UX/UI delarna i har vår kund ett designsystem som är kvalitetssäkrat och implementerat i de flesta flödena på deras webba och i appen, både inloggat och utloggat. Samt ett team som har processer och är riggat för förvaltning – och överlämning till dessa. Uppdraget är på heltid under 2025.

**Konsulten vår kund söker:**


Som senior UX/UI Designer har du dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ta fram och arbeta med designsystem och allt vad det innebär i minst ett större företag med flera utvecklingsteam. Du kan arbeta fram design både visuellt och funktionellt – arbetar självklart enligt UX designprocessen och har förmåga att driva och hålla ihop UX/UI arbetet i detta. Du brinner för designhantverket, interaktionsdesign och är en Figma ninja. Tillgänglighet är en självklar kompetens, ännu mer nu med aktuella lagkrav.

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att:**

* Bygga och förvalta designsystem med designtokens för våra varumärken
* Bygga upp komponentbibliotek i Figma för designsytemet.
* Användningstesta och tillgänglighetsgranska designsytemet.
* Vara med och ta fram mallar, principer och riktlinjer för designsytemet.
* Vara med och ta fram arbetssätt för hur de ska jobba med designsytemet i organisationen.
* Stödja och coacha teamen inom UX/UI design.
* Delta i samarbete med crossfunktionella team med UX, backendutvecklare, produktägare för att leverera en kundfokuserad användarupplevelse.
* Kvalitetsgranska och kvalitetstesta allt samt jobba enligt designprocess.

**Vår kund söker dig som har följande:**

* 5+ års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som UX/UI designer.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att visualisera ett koncept/lösning, t.ex. genom skisser, wireframes eller prototyper, från minst fyra tidigare uppdrag/projekt.
* Minst tre års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha haft huvudansvar för framtagning, implementering och förvaltning av designsystem, samt arbete med design tokens i digitala projekt.
* Minst tre års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat med webbplatser som uppfyller tillgänglighetskravet WCAG AAA och därmed kan tillämpa metoder inom tillgänglighet och tillgänglighetsgranskning
* Erfarenhet av att implementera och förvalta komplexa designsytem i större organisationer
* Stor vana att kommunicera, hantera stakeholders, samarbeta och presentera.
* Erfarenhet i att arbeta i organisationer som arbetar i agila processer och SAFe.

**Det är meriterande om du har följande:**

* Branscherfarenhet inom bank och finans.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av lead-roll inom design och/eller av att ha arbetat med DesignOps, t.ex. utveckling av processer och arbetsätt i syfte att höja effektiviteten och kvaliteten i en grupps designarbete som helhet.
* Har god förståelse för HTML och CSS, samt erfarenhet av att samarbeta med frontend-utvecklare för att säkerställa att designen implementeras korrekt.


Som person ser vår kund att du är social, kommunikativ, ödmjuk, tålmodig, kreativ, resultatinriktad och övertygad om att det alltid finns lösningar på komplexa problem. Du är ansvarstagande och har hög förmåga att driva frågor själv samtidigt en fena på samarbete. Du involverar och vägleder andra och samarbetar gärna tvärfunktionellt. Vidare skapar du förtroende genom bemötande och kunskap och ser ständigt lärande som en självklarhet. Du är van vid att presentera lösningar och koncept för större publik. Du har en pedagogisk förmåga och du har en förmåga att förenkla och beskriva teknisk komplexitet på lagom nivå för olika målgrupper. Vår kund ser att du är en driven person som är van att navigera i olika forum med olika typer av intressenter.

**Kunskaper i svenska (muntligt och skriftligt) krävs:** JA, behövs för dokumentation och kunskapsöverföring

 **Språk**: Svenska och Engelska


**Required skills:** Designsystem, UX/UI, Agile, SAFe


Tillgänglighetsgranskning

**Preferred skills:** CSS, DesignOps, Design lead, HTML, Frontend, Bank och Finans, Tillgänglighetsgranskning  

  

**Omfattning:** 100%  

  

**Assignment period:** 13 Jan 2025 - 31 Dec 2025

**Application deadline:** 11 Dec 2024

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
For our client we are looking for a **Senior UX Designer.**

 **Responsibilities:**

* Execute a range of UX tasks across the platforms, delivering intuitive and user-friendly solutions.
* Utilize your design skills to bring concepts to life, ensuring clear and impactful designs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to refine user interfaces, enhancing overall user experience.
* Assist in managing stakeholders, understanding their needs, and aligning design solutions with business objectives.
* Communicate effectively with various teams, fostering collaboration and ensuring a well-defined design process.
* Contribute to the development and adoption of design best practices and methodologies.
* Assist in overseeing the design process from ideation to implementation, ensuring high-quality design outcomes.
* Ensure that work is delivered in accordance with set guidelines and appointed design system.
* Ensure compliance with best practice standards in UX, branding, design systems, and relevant legal and accessibility standards, ensuring optimal implementation.
* Provide guidance and support to junior designers, offering constructive feedback and mentorship.
* Actively participate in the broader UX community, contributing to knowledge sharing efforts and collaborative projects.

**Competences:**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field such as Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, User Experience, or a related discipline.
* 3-5 years of professional experience in UX design.
* Demonstrated ability to contribute to UX projects throughout the design lifecycle.
* Solid portfolio demonstrating successful design projects across various platforms and devices.
* Ability to effectively communicate design decisions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Familiarity with design tools such as Sketch, Figma, or Adobe Creative Suite.

  

**Required skills:** UX design, Sketch, Figma, Human-Computer Interaction, Adobe Creative Suite

**Languages:** English(Proficient)

**Location:** Gothenburg (SE)

**Assignment period:** 16 Dec 2024 - 31 Dec 2025

**Application deadline:** 12 Dec 2024

title: R&D Senior Software engineer
description:
Senior Software engineer for MicroSCADA X Substation HMI for Power Quality Applications

**Your responsibilities:**

* Create the next generation HMI solution for PQ Control and Protection System on Substation level.
* Collaborate with the UX/UI conceptual design team to develop the Substation HMI solution in MicroSCADA X.
* Test and debug the Substation HMI solution.
* Train and support the organization in applying the HMI solution in our delivery projects.
* Work in our agile teams to provide our delivery organization with new feature and application.
* You will become part of a dedicated team, in which we work together to handle all requirements from different stakeholders, collaboration is, in other words, a central part of your new position and is a key competence which will enable your possibilities of further career opportunities and personal growth.
* Living our client's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business

**Your background and competences:**

* A University degree within a relevant technical area along with competence and experience within UX and HMI development.
* Experience in conceptual UX design preferably related to Substation and/or Power Systems.
* Proven work experience as a Web/HMI Front-end developer
* Hands on experience with HTML/XML markup languages
* Experience with JavaScript and HTML5.
* Familiarity with HMI testing and debugging.
* In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)
* Preferably experience in develop MicroSCADA X HMI and SCIL programming.
* You will work together with experts in the field. It is an advantage if you have worked within a scrum, agile or lean setup previously and if you like to troubleshoot and test your own solutions.
* Driven problem solver who eagerly takes initiatives and always delivers on time and according to expectations.
* Proficient in English

**Duration:** 6 months

title: Senior System Engineer - Gothenburg
description:
**Assignment description**


For our client we are looking for a **System Engineer, Gothenburg (SE).**

  

Our client has an exciting opportunity for you to be part of the development of the next generation infotainment system using Google's Android automotive OS.

**Who You Are:**

  

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proven experience in system engineering and software requirement management.
* Detail-oriented with a structured approach to work.
* Familiarity with requirement management tools and methodologies.

 **What You’ll Do:**

  

* Conduct risk assessments and test analysis for functionalities.
* Work closely with development teams to ensure requirements are understood and implemented correctly.
* Collaborate with UX designers, development teams and stakeholders.
* Gather, analyze, and document system requirements for several functionalities in the infotainment system.
* Ensure requirements meet high standards of compliance and traceability.
* Assist in the development and maintenance of project documentation.
* Support testing and validation processes to ensure requirements are met.

**Knowledge and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent experience.
* Several years of experience in automotive system development.
* Familiarity with tools like SystemWeaver, TeamCenter, Integrity, or CANoe.
* Knowledge of distributed electrical/software systems and architecture.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
* Valid driver’s license (B).
* Understanding of development processes and agile methodologies is a plus.

*If you are interested we recommend you to apply immediately!*

 **Required skills**


CANoe, distributed electrical/software systems, Teamcenter, IntegrityTest Analysis, Systemweaver, Requirement Management, Risk Assessment, Automotive system development

**Preferred skills**


Agile

**Languages**


English(Proficient)

20250106 - 20251231

title: Junior UI Designer
description:
As a UI designer, you will be one of the guardians of the overall user experience of our product. Your primary focus will be on creating visually stunning interfaces. Collaborating with the product development team, you will contribute to designing new concepts for flows and functionality to enhance our core product.
   

  

 Join us in designing a new, innovative design system and setting guidelines and best practices that will streamline collaboration between designers, developers, and stakeholders. To enhance your design skills and improve your work, you will closely collaborate with the design lead and the entire design team, receiving different types of feedback. Conducting user tests and interviews with focus groups, you will validate and refine your designs. Additionally, you will have full access to our analytics tools, empowering you to make data-driven decisions.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Be part of shaping the visual identity of the brand.
* Extend and establish a comprehensive design system.
* Create easy-to-use templates and inspiring guidelines.
* Visualise concepts and solutions through sketches, prototypes, and blueprints.
* Collaborate with stakeholders, designers, and developers to create intuitive, user-friendly software.


**Who are we looking for?**
 We are looking for someone who is self-driven, deeply passionate about white space and shades of color palettes and understands how thoughtful design can make a UI both intuitive, clean, and enjoyable to use. We firmly believe that how a product feels is just as important as how it looks.
   

  

* You are at the beginning of your career as a designer, whether you have a few years of experience or you have just graduated.
* You can confidently communicate in English.
* You should be familiar with the design tool Figma.
* You feel comfortable participating and leading workshops.
* We’d love to see your portfolio — whether it’s personal or professional projects (ideas, prototypes), volunteer work, or assignments — that showcase your creativity and how you approach improving user experiences of responsive websites or apps.


**It’s a plus if you:**
* Understand how to use a Design System
* Have led workshops outside of school/assignments
* Have been volunteering in a design organization, or volunteering in general.


**What we provide:**
* You will be part of a design team, learning and gaining insights from experienced designers with different backgrounds. They will serve as mentors, helping you grow and enhance your design skills.
* An International and open working atmosphere with colleagues of many nationalities.
* To be in the lead of a fast-growing company.
* Plenty of space for initiative and the ability to grow your own skills and experience.
* Awesome colleagues and a social work environment.
* Hybrid working, but with a team that also enjoys meeting up IRL and having a Friday beer or Monday breakfast at the office located centrally in Stockholm.
* To be a part of a product team that cares deeply for our customers.


 You will be surrounded by a talented, ambitious, and curious team that loves to listen, discuss ideas, and help in any way they can. We are a diverse team consisting of people from different countries, cultures, and backgrounds. At Keystone, you will both give and receive tasks from others. Collaboration is crucial.
   

  

**Our Company**
 Keystone is trusted by more than 120 million unique prospective students every year to help students and learners make one of the most important decisions of their lifetimes, namely, which higher education degree program or course to attend.
   

  

 In turn, Keystone helps over 5 750 education institutions reach, recruit, and enroll students in more than 190 countries, across 460 student websites, including educations.com, studentum.se, and FindAMasters. Keystone also operates a range of other global student recruitment services, including Blueberry.nu, Keystone Sports and Keystone Recruit.
   

  

 Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, Keystone is backed by Viking Venture and Verdane, two leading Nordic venture firms. With offices across the Nordics, Germany, and the UK, Keystone has an international staff of more than 900+ employees. We are a vibrant and talented group of global citizens with a true passion for education and technology, and our vision is to help everyone in the world find the right education.
   

  

 This role is not eligible for sponsorship.
   

  

*Keystone is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Design System Designer
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
 Arrive's Design System Team mission is to empower teams across Arrive to create seamless, consistent, and delightful digital experiences through Rally, our multi-platform design system. We are committed to ensuring accessibility, inclusivity, and innovation in every aspect of our design system, enabling Arrive to deliver exceptional user experiences at scale.
   

  

 Our goal is to provide a unified foundation that streamlines the design and development process, ensures brand consistency, and enhances the usability of Arrive's digital products.
   

  

 Product design is essential in reaching our goal. Our design team, currently consisting of +25 members, also aspires to broaden Arrive's offerings into new markets. This presents significant potential to improve user experience and contribute to substantial business impact.
   

  

 The broader R&D organization includes a genuinely diverse and distributed team of over 450 talented specialists in product, engineering, design, and analytics; located across Stockholm, Amsterdam, Basingstoke, Tallinn, Atlanta and more.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Design System Designer at Arrive, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping Rally, our multi-platform design system. You will craft and maintain a comprehensive set of UX and visual guidelines, ensuring consistency and accessibility across all digital products. Collaborating closely with designers, developers, and product managers, you’ll create reusable UI components and design patterns that meet stakeholder needs and elevate the user experience. Your role involves documenting best practices, design standards, and usage guidelines, while also conducting design reviews to ensure proper implementation of Rally. Staying ahead of industry trends, you’ll integrate best practices into the system and champion the creation of accessible, inclusive, and innovative design solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain UX and visual guidelines for all digital products, continuously improving Rally Design System.
* Create reusable UI components and design patterns for use across platforms.
* Collaborate with designers, developers, and product managers to align the design system with stakeholder needs.
* Document design standards, best practices, and usage guidelines for Rally.
* Ensure all design system components are accessible and inclusive.
* Conduct design reviews and provide guidance for implementing the design system.
* Stay updated on industry trends and integrate best practices into the design system.


**What You’ll Bring To The Team**
* Strong visual design skills with keen attention to detail.
* Proficiency in tools like Figma, Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite.
* Basic knowledge of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
* Understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Systematic thinking with the ability to solve complex design challenges.
* Experience with version control systems like Git.
* Familiarity with design tokens and their implementation.


**About Us**
*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Senior Visual Designer
description:
Are you ready to impact the future of gaming through design? North Kingdom is looking for an experienced visual designer to join our team in Stockholm.
 



 You will be a key-part of our team in shaping, defining and crafting the visual vision of our projects. As a Designer you are passionate about the craft, always curious, and leave no details behind. At North Kingdom, we take pride in always striving to deliver world-class experiences and services for clients such as Google, Supercell, EA, Riot and 10 Chambers.
 



 You have a solid understanding of UX, and are able to execute design solutions that not only look good, but also feel alive and great to use.
 



 This position is full time and based in Stockholm with a hybrid working model. Make sure to attach a link to your portfolio (Applicants with no portfolio won't be reviewed).
 



  






 Responsibilities
 




 In your role you will have a wide range of tasks that will include:
 


* Make sure the entire team understands the visual vision and feels motivated to strive toward the same goal
* Present and pitch to clients
* Take design briefs and create design systems/solutions, protecting the quality and craft of the ideas when they move through to production



  






 Requirements & Skills
 



* Several years of experience within digital design, preferably at a digital production company or agency
* Deep knowledge of applications like Figma, Photoshop, and Illustrator
* Great understanding of the opportunities and limitations of the modern web
* Great aesthetic sensibilities, experience in motion a plus
* Comfortable with and used to speaking and presenting in English
* Exceptional communication skills both in writing and speech
* A relevant degree or education in design (a plus, not a requirement)
* A background in illustration, art or 3D is a plus



  






 Who you are
 



* A team player who can take initiative and develop solutions
* A problem-solver who can align solutions with client needs
* You have the ability to oversee the process of a project and quality control on design polish
* You treat challenges as opportunities and come at them with an optimistic viewpoint



  





  






 Working at North Kingdom
 




 North Kingdom is the creative arm for Gaming & Entertainment within NoA Ignite.
 



 It's our ambition to be the best workplace in the world. We believe you should use both your passion and mastery in your work, get inspired, feel safe, work hard and have fun. We expect you to be professional, brave, honest and engaged, but most importantly: be You.
 



  






 What you get
 



* Pension contribution
* Private health insurance
* Parental leave top-up
* 5,000 SEK health care allowance
* Flexible work hours



 Are we everything you ever looked for in a workplace? Get in touch! We are meeting applicants on an ongoing basis. There is no need for a personal letter or a CV. Just provide a link to your LinkedIn profile and attach your portfolio. That's it! Next up: if your profile matches what we are looking for, we will reach out to you as soon as possible.

title: Mid/Senior Interaction Designer with Technical Skills
description:
**About Jungle & the Job** 




 We’re Jungle - a growing design agency in Stockholm. We create digital products, services, and experiences that make a difference. Our team is small, tight-knit, and full of designers and developers who love working together, helping each other grow, and having fun along the way.
 



  





 We’re looking for a mid/senior interaction designer who can design and manage the development of digital products and experiences. You’ll lead the design of digital products and experiences from UX research, to wireframes and flows, to UI designs and ongoing development.
 



  





 This is a role for someone who thrives on both sides: crafting beautiful, intuitive and innovative experiences and bringing them to life through clean, scalable designs. You’ll act as both the design lead and product manager on projects, guiding everything from concept to production delivery.
 



  





**What you'll do** 




  




* Lead the interaction design on websites, apps, and digital products - across flows, structure, and UI.
* Execute UX research, including interviews and testing.
* Contribute to and maintain component-based design systems.
* Product management - manage the build of designs as a product owner would.
* Represent the user, the design, and some technical perspectives in workshops, stand-ups, and client meetings



  





**What we're looking for** 




  




* Strong background in interaction design and UX.
* Experience shipping real digital products - ideally where you designed the UI.
* Front-end development skills are a huge plus - we websites and apps in-house, so someone who can contribute in multiple ways is a star for us.
* Excellent Figma skills (from concept to systemized components and prototypes).
* Comfort working with agile development processes.
* Experience building or scaling design systems in production.
* Fluent English and working proficiency in Swedish (for meetings and workshops).



  





**The kind of projects that you'll work on** 




  




* End-to-end product builds where you lead both design and development.
* Websites and tools where performance, usability, and aesthetics matter.
* Cross-functional projects where your skill set keeps everything aligned.
* Design system work that lives in both Figma and codebases.



  





**What we offer** 




  




* Competitive salary and benefits, including ITP 1 pension, private healthcare, and wellness allowance.
* Flexible working hours and hybrid work options (office/home).
* Yearly company inspiration trips.
* (Roller coasters and bathroom museums not included).



  





**What we value** 




  




* A love for design and technology - you enjoy both shaping and shipping.
* Curiosity - you keep an eye on new tools, AI, and tech trends.
* Team spirit - we work best together.
* Empathy - you care about users, clients, and colleagues.



  





**Does this sound like you?** 




 If this sounds like your kind of gig, we’d love to hear from you!
 



 job@jungledesign.co

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**DIGITAL MARKETING SPECIALIST** 




  





**Position** 
 : Digital Marketing Specialist
 



**Team** 
 : Client Engagement
 



**Location** 
 : on site Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Employment Type** 
 : full time
 



  





**ABOUT CAPE CAPITAL** 




 We are a wealth manager with an exceptional in-house product offering, allowing us to provide tailored investment opportunities to our clients - delivered by an internationally diverse team of professionals. Our mindset is entrepreneurial, creative and solution oriented. We always aim to recruit those that fit our personality, mindset, and outlook in every sense.
 



 We are a small, dynamic team, so applicants need to be self-driven, well-organised and show flexibility to support in different areas, as tasks arise.
 



  





**OVERVIEW** 




 We are seeking a proactive and versatile Digital Marketing Specialist to join our Client Engagement team. This role will drive our digital evolution projects, focusing on enhancing client experience through innovative digital marketing platforms, website management, and creative content development. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with project management skills and hands-on experience in UX/UI design.
 



  





**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES** 



* **Project management - digital evolution** 
 : Lead and manage digital transformation projects, including planning, execution, and monitoring of initiatives to enhance our digital presence and client engagement.
* **Website updates & maintenance** 
 : Oversee regular updates, maintenance, and optimisation of the company website to ensure functionality, performance, and alignment with brand goals.
* **Content & social media management** 
 : Develop, curate, and manage engaging content across digital platforms (e.g., social media, blogs, newsletters) to boost brand awareness and client interaction.
* **Agency collaboration for UX/UI** 
 : Work closely with external agencies to ensure user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) designs of digital platforms meet client needs and industry standards.
* **Video editing** 
 : Create and edit high-quality video content for marketing campaigns, social media, and client presentations to enhance storytelling and engagement.
* **Data & graphics** 
 : Design and produce compelling data in support of client advisory materials.



  





**REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS** 




**Experience** 
 :
 


* 3-5 years in digital marketing, with proven experience in digital projects.
* Hands-on experience in UX/UI design, including collaboration on web-based platforms.



**Technical skills** 
 :
 


* Proficiency in digital marketing tools including Webflow and HubSpot
* Familiarity with website management platforms and basic HTML/CSS knowledge, as well as analytics tools
* Experience with creative tools (e.g., Tableau, Canva, Adobe Creative Suite)
* Video editing skills using tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar.
* Knowledge of UX/UI design tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD) for collaboration with agencies.



**Project management** 
 :
 


* Strong ability to manage multiple projects independently, meet deadlines, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.



  





 Fluency and communications expertise in English is a must.
 



  





**IDEAL QUALITIES** 



* **Self-starter mindset** 
 : Demonstrated ability to take initiative, prioritize tasks, and drive projects to completion with minimal supervision.
* **Communication** 
 : Excellent verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with clients, agencies, internal teams and senior stakeholders.
* **Education** 
 : Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, design, or a related field (preferred but not mandatory if work experience is strong).



  





**NICE-TO-HAVE** 



* Knowledge of emerging digital trends (e.g., AI-driven marketing, automation, Web3).
* Experience in supplier management, ensuring alignment between digital strategies and client expectations.
* Certifications in digital marketing (e.g., Google Analytics, HubSpot) or UX/UI design.
* Experience in financial services marketing



  





**WHY JOIN US?** 




 We are a small Client Engagement team dedicated to evolving our digital presence and delivering exceptional client experiences in the wealth management industry, primarily through content. As a Digital Marketing Specialist, you’ll have the opportunity to lead impactful projects, collaborate with creative agencies, and make a tangible impact on our digital evolution.
 



  





**HOW TO APPLY** 




 Please submit your resume, evidence of digital competence, and a brief cover letter explaining your experience and motivations to tess@capecapital.com. Applicants must have a permit to work in Sweden.

title: Managementkonsult inom Product & Tech
description:
Går du liksom vi igång på digitala kundupplevelser och hur ny teknik kan omsättas för att nå affärsmål och skapa affärsvärde? Du har stort fokus på din kompetensutveckling och vill bygga erfarenhet inom olika branscher. Om du dessutom vill jobba på ett chefslöst företag där du själv sitter i förarsätet och din ambition styr din utveckling kanske du är en av de stjärnor vi ständigt letar efter!
   

  

 Allt fler värdeerbjudande digitaliseras, fler kanaler adderas, den digitala kundrelationen fördjupas och den tekniska utvecklingen driver på i rekordfart. Det är inom detta glödheta område Product & Tech bygger kompetens och förmågor för att hjälpa våra kunder.
   

  

**Vad vi gör**
 Vi leder våra kunder och ger dem genomförandekraft och accelerationsförmåga att snabbt komma ut med nya moderna digitala tjänster och produkter till sina kunder och användare. Vi driver utveckling från idé till vass produkt i många olika roller, där vi som ledare kombinerar stor förståelse för hur teknik möjliggör affärsvärde med ett agilt förhållningssätt och kunskap om nödvändiga delar inom modern systemutvecklingsprocess.
   

  

**Vi växer och söker fler kollegor som vill jobba inom Product & Tech**
 För att möta omgivningens och kundernas förväntningar på snabb digital tjänste- och produktutveckling behöver företag ställa om och skapa moderna produktutvecklingsorganisationer med nya förmågor och kompetenser. Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med och hjälpa våra kunder genom hela den digitala produktlivscykeln, och har förmåga och kompetens inom:
   

  

* Product Management – erfarenhet av strategisk och operativ produktledning samt kunskap i hur en effektiv produktorganisation bör sättas upp och fungera.
* Product Design – erfarenhet av att identifiera användares verkliga behov samt konkretisera dessa i prototyper, user stories och tilltalande värdeskapande digitala användargränssnitt.
* Ledning av agil produktutveckling – kunskap kring hur en effektiv systemutveckling riggas och erfarenhet av att ta ledande roller i sådana tvärfunktionella team, såsom exempelvis Produktägare, Scrum Master, Business Analyst och Test Manager.


**Din profil**
* Du har cirka 3-7 års erfarenhet av att jobba nära digital produktutveckling och har helst arbetat några år som managementkonsult
* Du har haft ledande roller i agil produktutveckling eller IT-relaterade projekt
* Du har intresse för teknik och vad den kan bidra med för affären, är nyfiken och allmänt bevandrad kring ny teknik
* Du utgår alltid från användarnas behov och kanske har erfarenhet av UX/UI
* Du kan ha erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknik och produktvalsfrågor, och har övergripande förståelse för systemarkitektur och leverantörsutvärdering
* Du är driven och tar stort eget ansvar, både för din kund och din egen utveckling
* Relevant akademisk examen, såsom civilingenjör eller Bachelor/Master
* Du behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


****Framgångsrika konsulter på Centigo har oftast tre framträdande styrkor:****
**Entreprenörsanda** 
 – De motiveras av komplexa utmaningar och drivs av en stark vilja att lösa dem. Med ett högt engagemang och ansvarstagande, värdesätter de möjligheten att dra nytta av och bidra till det nätverk som Centigo erbjuder.
   

  

**Ambitionsdriven** 
 – De drivs av sina egna höga ambitioner och tar ansvar för sin affär såväl som sin professionella och personliga utveckling.
   

  

**Professionell** 
 – Att arbeta med en hög grad av professionalism är nyckeln till ett framgångsrikt konsultarbete. Våra konsulter är alltid måna om att leverera produkter av god kvalitet till våra kunder.

title: Product Manager Digital Transformation of Funding
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to grow ideas in an unconventional environment. At the same time, you’ll work in a culture of ongoing learning and development, allowing you to constantly expand your area of expertise.
   

  

 We are seeking a Product Manager to lead the digital transformation of our funding operations – a multi-year, multi-million SEK initiative that will fundamentally reshape how we serve our customers. With 75% of our business flowing through the funding process, this transformation is critical to our continued growth and success. As our business scales rapidly, our legacy systems (developed 2011-2017) can no longer support current volumes and complexity. This role will drive the modernization of our funding processes through three strategic pillars: digitalization of data, processes, and communication.
   

  

 You'll own the product vision for transforming our funding ecosystem from manual, paper-based workflows to AI-enhanced, digital-first experiences that serve customers, funding consultants, Speech-Language Pathologists, and physicians. This includes both modernizing existing capabilities and developing entirely new solutions that reimagine how funding operations could work.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
**Strategic Product Leadership**
* Define and execute the product roadmap for our Digital Transformation Initiative
* Translate complex funding domain requirements into clear product specifications for development teams
* Balance stakeholder needs across customers, internal funding team, SLPs, physicians, and insurance payers
* Drive user-centered design thinking to challenge existing processes and identify optimization opportunities
* Lead both incremental system improvements and greenfield product development initiatives
* Re-engineer processes from the ground up rather than simply digitizing existing workflows


**Cross-Functional Collaboration**
* Partner with diverse development teams to deliver solutions ranging from system enhancements to completely new platforms
* Work with funding operations experts to understand insurance requirements, state-by-state variations, and regulatory compliance needs
* Coordinate with change management teams to ensure successful user adoption across all stakeholder groups
* Collaborate with external partners and vendors on innovative solutions that transcend current organizational constraints
* Manage development initiatives that require creative freedom to reimagine processes rather than replicate existing systems


**Product Development & Delivery**
* Lead requirements gathering through user research, process mapping, and stakeholder interviews
* Manage feature prioritization and scope decisions across the transformation roadmap
* Oversee UX/UI design processes to ensure intuitive and mobile-responsive experiences
* Drive development of AI-enhanced capabilities including OCR document processing and automated eligibility verification
* Ensure data quality, security, and compliance throughout all solutions


**User Experience & Adoption**
* Champion the customer experience from initial application through device delivery
* Design digital-first processes that reduce manual work and processing times
* Create seamless experiences for funding consultants using new case management tools
* Develop enhanced tools for SLPs and streamlined capabilities for physician interactions


**Your Impact**
 This transformation will modernize our funding operations through digitalization of data, processes, and communication. You'll lead the development of AI-enhanced automation, payer system integrations, and comprehensive case management solutions that will fundamentally change how we serve our customers and scale our operations.
   

  

**What You Bring**
**Required Experience**
* 3-5 years of product management experience, preferably with internal tools or B2B solutions
* Proven track record of leading cross-functional teams through complex system transformations
* Experience with both incremental system improvements and greenfield product development
* Strong analytical skills with ability to translate business processes into technical requirements
* Background in user research, requirements gathering, and stakeholder management
* Demonstrated ability to re-engineer processes rather than simply digitize existing workflows


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in healthcare, insurance, government, or other administratively complex/regulated industries
* Familiarity with DME, AAC, or assistive technology markets
* Knowledge of insurance reimbursement processes or payer integrations
* Experience with AI/ML integration in business applications
* Background in process improvement or operational efficiency initiatives


**Essential Skills**
* Process thinking: Ability to map complex workflows and reimagine them from first principles
* User empathy: Deep focus on understanding and solving real user problems
* Technical collaboration: Comfortable working with diverse development teams and technology approaches
* Change leadership: Experience driving adoption of entirely new tools and processes
* Communication: Clear, compelling storytelling to align diverse stakeholders
* Creative problem-solving: Ability to design solutions unconstrained by existing system limitations
* Adaptability: Comfortable working with varying levels of organizational context and development approaches


**Why This Role Matters**
 This position sits at the intersection of technology and human impact. The funding transformation you'll lead directly affects families' access to life-changing communication devices. Your work will reduce administrative burden on our team, streamline experiences for customers navigating complex insurance processes, and enable Tobii Dynavox to scale our mission of giving people their voice.
   

  

 You'll have the opportunity to build something from the ground up, working with cutting-edge AI and integration technologies while solving real-world problems that matter. This is a rare chance to own the product vision for a comprehensive digital transformation with measurable business impact and meaningful human outcomes.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: First-Line Support
description:
**About The Position**
 We are growing rapidly – transitioning from startup to scaleup – and expanding our footprint across the Nordics and Europe. Our clients range from some of Europe’s largest banks and iGaming companies to smaller, disruptive players.
   

  

 We are now looking for a skilled and service-minded
 **First-Line Support** 
 to join our IT team. This is not a junior role – we’re looking for someone with a solid foundation in support work who thrives in the space between IT and customer care. You’ll be the first line of contact for incoming technical questions, and a key player in helping customers and users – external – to resolve issues effectively and professionally.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As First-Line Support, you will:
   

  

* Respond to customer inquiries and technical issues with professionalism and clarity in accordance with customer SLAs
* Perform basic troubleshooting of software, connectivity, system-related issues, web applications, iframes, JSON APIs, and hardware
* Log, track and document issues, including all steps taken and final resolutions
* Escalate complex issues to the appropriate team members while maintaining ownership of the ticket
* Help build and improve internal documentation and knowledge bases
* Contribute to continuous improvement of support workflows and processes
* Ensure a great user experience, even in high-pressure or sensitive situations


**Who You Are**
 You are a calm, solution-oriented professional with a genuine interest in both tech and people. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where adaptability and communication are key.
   

  

**We Believe You Bring**
* A diploma or degree in IT, Computer Science or similar field
* +2 years of experience in a first-line or technical support role
* Proven ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
* Strong troubleshooting skills and service mindset
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* Experience with standard IT tools and environments
* Experience providing technical support for web-based applications, including iframe integrations and JSON-based APIs
* A structured approach and the ability to prioritize when everything feels urgent


**Meritorious Skills**
* Experience in Open Banking/PSD2
* Experience with Jira Service Desk, Linear and Slack (Our support plattforms)


**What Kreditz Can Offer**
* Growth Journey: A unique chance to be part of a rapidly growing scaleup where every team member plays a crucial role in the company's success.
* Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse, fun-loving, and collaborative team that celebrates both big and small milestones together.
* Wellness Perks: 24/7 access to an on-site gym, sauna, and sports center, plus a wellness allowance.
* Medical insurance: Quick access to professional medical advice and care
* Compensation: Fixed salary


**APPOINTMENT OF ROL** 
**E**
 As soon as possible
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent position (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Fixed monthly salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company's IT Manager
   

  

**Workplace**
 Danderyd, Stockholm (on-site)
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection)
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, COO, lorenzo@kreditz.com

title: Product Lead, Live - Contraband
description:
Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open world action game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios, is now looking for a Product Lead to join the team!
   

  

**The Position**
 As the Product Lead for Live, you are responsible for the player acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization strategy of our Live service. You will own the product vision for Live, optimize player value for our Live KPIs, manage a small team of Product Managers, and lead Marketing, Community and Analytics for the project.
   

  

 You will also be a key stakeholder of the Development team on new Live game features, content, and platform capabilities, and represent Live towards our publisher. Your primary focus will be on prioritizing the development roadmap and ensuring all releases meet their targets.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Define and drive the product strategy for the Live service.
* Optimize player value to improve acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization KPIs.
* Identifying opportunities through live data, community playtests, market research and player insights
* Define and realise a high-fidelity Live plan for the next 6 months. Manage the Live features backlog
* Hire, manage and mentor a team of Product Managers.
* Lead collaboration with the Marketing and Community teams; serve as the main client for Data Science.
* Act as a major stakeholder of the Development team to help define new Live game features, content, and platform capabilities.
* Provide regular Live performance updates and recommendations to the game leadership.
* Represent the Live service towards Microsoft.


**Who You Are**
* A strategic product leader with a deep understanding of gamers’ desires and preferences, and a keen eye for market trends.
* Experienced in overseeing the entire lifecycle of a Live service, from conception to release and live operation, with a focus on continuous updates, expansions, and events.
* Ideally on 1 Live AAA title or more, with a large publisher.
* Adept at bridging creative vision with business objectives to deliver unrivaled player experiences while meeting financial goals.
* Skilled in navigating the evolving landscape of gaming platforms, player communities, and emerging technologies.
* Proven ability to lead a team and to collaborate effectively with Development, Marketing, Community, and Analytics.
* Proficient in data-informed decision-making, utilizing analytics, player insights, and market research.
* Knowledgeable about personalization and player-centric approaches to deliver tailored gameplay and customized content.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Staff Data Scientist
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world's #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 420 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at The Search team** 
 are responsible for some of the most vital and impactful features of the Truecaller application. These include:
   

  

* **Caller Identification** 
 : Identifying who is calling and making sure users can take educated decisions to pick up or not
* **Spam Protection:** 
 Identifying and blocking spam numbers, calculating spam likelihood, and enhancing overall spam detection.
* **Name Accuracy:** 
 Guaranteeing that users see the most accurate and reliable names associated with numbers.
* **Fraud Protection:** 
 Developing and maintaining services to protect users from fraudulent calls and scams.


**As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team** 
 , you will drive critical initiatives focused on spam prevention,name election, and experimentation. This role requires a very strong foundation in advanced statistics, machine learning, and engineering, along with a passion for delivering measurable impact at mega scale.Focused on spam prevention, name election, and experimentation. This role requires a very strong foundation in advanced statistics, machine learning, and engineering, along with a passion for delivering measurable impact at mega scale.
   

  

**The impact you will create:**
* Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
* Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
* Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
* Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
* Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
* Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.


**What you bring in:**
* **Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science** 
 , Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or a related field.
* **At-least 7 years of experience** 
 in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
* A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
* Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
* Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
* **Excellent communication** 
 and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
* **Strong problem-solving skills** 
 and a results-oriented mindset
* Customer obsession
* Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time


**It would be great if you also have:**
* Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
* Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
* Experience with data from mobile applications
* Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
* Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There's something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.**
