 We expect you to combine strong entrepreneurial and leadership skills with market knowledge and a relevant network to deliver best-in-class IT services. You are proactive, results-oriented, and thrive on achieving success together with your team.
   

  

 This is a high-impact leadership role where you will combine your deep expertise in Management and Strategic IT Consulting with the opportunity to influence real business outcomes.
   

  

 Your core responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Client Engagement: Develop and maintain strong executive-level client relationships, with a focus on strategic business development and value creation.
* Leadership: Develop, coach and inspire a high-performing leadership team for the unit, supporting their career growth and professional development.
* Business Operations: Lead your unit to meet financial targets, ensuring profitability and sustainable growth.


 You will ensure that your unit delivers measurable business value by seamlessly integrating IT consulting and in depth industry knowledge into a unified offering.
   

  

 Together with your leadership team and other CGI units, both local and international, you will proactively build and expand relationships with both new and existing clients—at the C-level.
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 We are seeking an experienced executive leader with a strong track record in the consulting industry and a passion for business transformation. You are energized by strategic challenges and have a proven ability to lead through influence and vision.
   

  

 Key qualifications:
   

  

* Minimum 15 years of experience in the consulting industry, including at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
* Deep understanding of the digital transformation landscape within the manufacturing sector.
* Demonstrated success in IT/Consulting and strategic sales, particularly in building executive-level presence and engineering complex deals.
* Proven ability to deliver results in large, complex organizations.
* Strong analytical skills and a pragmatic, solution-oriented mindset.


 You are a strategic thinker with the ability to define and execute long-term plans in a complex environment. You lead with inspiration and integrity, and you value people as the foundation of success.
   

  

 Background checks and security checks will be required.
   

  

 If you have any question you may reach out to responsible recruiter: Johanna Havervall, TA Manager, johanna.havervall@cgi.com
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Solution Architect for C&IS Institutional Global Custody | SEB
description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of cutting-edge solutions in the financial sector? Do you thrive in an environment where innovation meets real-world challenges? If yes, then we've got an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

**About Us**
 We are at the forefront of transformation within the C&IS Institutional Global Custody ART, driving the evolution of both new and existing solutions towards our visionary target architecture. Our goal is to o deliver unparalleled digital experiences that meet the ever-changing demands of our clients and leverage the latest technological advancements. Our Execution and Post Trade Services (EPTS) domain delivers post-trade products and services to a variety of client types and segments for example, Large Corporates, Financial Institutions, Retail Customers, Private Wealth Management and Family Office.
   

  

 What will you be doing?
   

  

 Lead the Way: As a Solution Architect, you'll be instrumental in guiding our teams towards adopting and implementing our defined architecture in their daily development activities. Your expertise will serve as the compass that ensures we're always moving in the right direction.
   

  

 Build Bridges: You'll act as a trusted advisor, fostering strong partnerships with stakeholders across Business, Business Operations, and Technology. Your insights and recommendations will be crucial in aligning our architecture with the evolving needs of our Custody and Investment services.
   

  

 Drive Innovation: Join a tribe that values automation, efficiency, and regulatory compliance. You'll play a pivotal role in developing flexible, modern, and sustainable solutions that empower our customers to achieve their goals.
   

  

**Your Responsibility Will Be To**
* Work as a solution architect in the ART Institutional Global Custody
* Be part of the architect team in the Custody & Investment area
* Be part of the SEB architect community and interact with other architects in relevant parts of SEB to be able to align and materialize your architecture roadmaps.


**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe That You**
* Hav at least five years of experience from working with architecture and are passionate about creating business value by establishing robust and flexible architecture that involves different technologies and platforms,
* Experience from working with securities, equities and/or derivatives or at a bank, a financial institution or similar,
* Enjoy working in accordance with agile methodologies for example SAFe agile framework,
* Enjoy working with both strategic- and operational architecture,
* Have a bachelor’s or master´s degree in a relevant field,
* Are pragmatic in your solution ideas when you need to be and can visualize and clearly articulate consequences of various technologies and platforms (both verbally and in written form),
* Possess excellent networking and communication skills both within business and IT,
* Have a strong interest in keeping updated on the trends in the industry and technology and for the Custody & Investment area,
* Are fluent in English,
* Have a developer background.


**It Is An Advantage If You Have**
* Experience of working with APIs, GCP, Data, application development and procured IT systems.


 Ready to join?
   

  

 Do you want to be part of SEB? It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than June 15th 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Lena Dahlgren lena.dahlgren@seb.se we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts. https://sebgroup.com/career

title: EMEA Engineering Graduate Program (m/f/d)
description:
**Avnet Business Services GmbH**
 Avnet Business Services GmbH is the service provider of the Avnet Group in EMEA, founded in 2020. With its brands EBV Elektronik, Avnet Silica, Avnet Abacus, Avnet Embedded and Farnell, Avnet is one of the world's most successful distributors of semiconductor products and related services. Avnet is also an S&P 500 listed group. Employees in 70 countries set new standards every day in terms of innovation and quality, for which Avnet has been known in the market for 100 years.
   

  

 Have you recently graduated in the electronic engineering field (or similar area) and looking to begin your career?
   

  

 Do you think about an opportunity where you wake up in the morning with an always different day ahead of you, where you engage with customers being involved in innovative projects and help bringing ideas to reality?
   

  

 Do you want to put your theoretical knowledge of technology into practice and enrich it with the commercial aspect?
   

  

 Join us to take innovative ideas beyond the concept stage, providing the technical expertise and resources needed to bring ideas to market. Whether supporting makers, startups, or major global companies, you’ll be part of delivering end-to-end design solutions that help clients meet their goals and put you on the front seat driving tomorrow's technology.
   

  

 The
 **Avnet EMEA Engineering Graduate Program** 
 offers a broad insight into the entire World of Avnet.
   

  

 What do we mean by the 'World of Avnet'? Well, Avnet is not just a distributor of electronic components, it's a technical solution provider. What we do is vital to today’s technology-driven world.
   

  

 Get to know the World of Avnet, the diverse group of business units under its umbrella, each specializing in different business areas. Get to know them and create your individual career path based on what drives you.
   

  

*Shape the future of electronics - together with* 
 us!
   

  

**Framework**
 The program is scheduled for
 **15 months** 
 . The next start date is
 **October 01st, 2025** 
 .
   

  

 Do you want to know more about the program and its schedule?
 **Click** 
**here** 
 !
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
* An unlimited (permanent) full-time contract with great benefit packages
* An attractive engineering salary
* Possibility to work abroad in our EMEA-wide locations
* An experienced mentor to support your personal growth
* Your traineeship includes an onboarding week, workshops, and projects within your graduate trainee community
* A modern way of working with flexible and mobile options
* Thrive beyond work: further professional development opportunities with LinkedIn Learning access & personal well-being initiatives
* State-of-the-art technology and equipment
* One of the biggest players on the global electronic component distribution market
* A diverse, international company with flat hierarchies and a unique culture to grow


**What We Expect**
* Electronic engineering degree or comparable
* Passion for the technology industry
* Curious and open for an agile work environment
* Willingness to learn and adapt to a fast-changing business
* Strong communication skills
* Willingness to travel and work abroad
* Fluent in English
* Local language skills are beneficial
* Willing to work in an international and diverse environment
* Local driving license
* Determined team-player


**Are you interested in this exciting opportunity?**
**Send us your CV and a short cover letter.**
 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills.
   

  

 Avnet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. If you are interested in applying for employment with Avnet and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position contact our Human Resources Service Center in your region: Americas applicants – hrnow@avnet.com, Asia applicants - hrnow.asia@avnet.com, EMEA applicants - hrnow.EMEA@avnet.eu.
   

  

 Job Applicant EMEA Imprints

title: AI Growth Engineer
description:
Vi söker: AI Growth Engineer - Bygg framtidens AI med oss på COPR.
 



  





 Det här är inte bara ännu en konsultroll. Det här är chansen att vara den som lägger grunden för något banbrytande, med teknikens kraft och människan i centrum. Som AI Growth Engineer blir du en drivande kraft i COPR:s AI-satsning hos kunder. Du arbetar i gränslandet mellan affär och teknik och hjälper våra kunder att förbereda sig för morgondagens teknologier. Du kommer att jobba brett – inom data engineering, arkitektur och AI-strategi. Du skapar struktur, bygger plattformar och vägleder kunder från idé till verksamhetsvärde.
 



  





 Den här rollen passar dig som:
 



 ●Är entreprenöriell, innovativ och kommunikativ
 



 ●Har erfarenhet av data engineering, molninfrastruktur och analysplattformar, samt avend-to-end-lösningsdesign.
 



 ●Har praktisk, hands-on-erfarenhet av att möjliggöra och implementera Generativ AI.
 



 ●Vill vara med från början i något stort och meningsfullt.
 



 ●Tar ansvar, formar vägen och bygger COPR:s erbjudande
 



  





 Vad du kommer att göra:
 



 ●Designa och bygga AI-redo dataplattformar (tänk AWS, Kubernetes, dbt, SaaS)
 



 ●Definiera arkitektur och roadmaps – innan teamet finns på plats
 



 ●Jobba nära kunder för att förverkliga djärva idéer tekniskt
 



 ●Samarbeta med både IT och verksamhet för att skapa verklig förändring
 



 ●Förstärka stacken innan modellerna kommer – bygg för framtiden
 



  





 Varför det här är viktigt:
 



 Vi tror att AI börjar med människor som vågar. I den här rollen kommer ditt CV inte bara att växa – det får djup och en berättelse. Du står mitt i skärningspunkten mellan konsulting, entreprenörskap och verklig AI-transformation.
 



  





 Varför välja oss? Du blir en del av ett litet team med stor närvaro. Hos oss märks värme, nyfikenhet och ömsesidig respekt redan från första mötet.Vi uppmuntrar internt lärande och utveckling – och firar både små och stora segrar tillsammans. Våra COPR-meets är kunskapsdelning på riktigt. Här inspireras vi av varandra, testar nytt och växer tillsammans. ihop.
 



  





 Om oss
 



 COPR är ett konsultbolag i hjärtat av Stockholm, grundat 2015. Vi har en stabil kundbas med uppdrag inom affärsbanker, stora industriföretag, offentliga förvaltningar och myndigheter. Vi växer med omtanke och vill göra det med rätt människor. Skicka din ansökan eller frågor till jobb@copr.se. Vänta inte, sök redan idag men absolut senast den 30 juni!

title: IT Service Management Consultant
description:
Vi på B3 Business Transformation skapar framtidens kundmöte och vårt fokus är att få saker att hända på riktigt. Ofta handlar det om att stärka den digitala konkurrenskraften hos våra kunder genom att få till beslut och leda utveckling av nya digitala initiativ men även att förbättra den digital förmågan. Vi söker därför en IT Service Management konsult som vill vara med och utveckla våra kunders digitala tjänster till nya nivåer.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som konsult hos oss ges du möjligheter till intressanta uppdrag hos en mängd olika spännande kunder. Att du har förmågan att skapa relationer och på ett prestigelöst sätt samarbeta i team tror vi är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i ditt uppdrag. I rollen som ITSM kommer du att leda arbetet med att hantera tjänster. Det kan handla om att driva uppföljning av tjänsteleveranser och dess SLAer och KPIer, rapportering och förändringsledning. Många gånger handlar uppdragen även om att utveckla tjänster och processer hos kunden.
   

  

**Vi ser att du har följande kvalifikationer:**
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet från att förvalta och förbättra IT-tjänster (applikationer och drift) i roller som t.ex. IT Service Manager, IT Service Delivery Manager, Processledare (ITIL), Tjänsteförvaltare, Projektledare, Förvaltningsledare.
* Har ansvarat för eller varit en delaktig i arbetet kring tjänsteutveckling.
* Ha god kunskap inom agila ramverk och ITIL.
* Är intresserad av AI och ser fördelen med detta för att förbättra tjänsteleveranser, processautomatisering eller analys av driftdata.
* Har god förmåga att arbeta strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt.
* Det är meriterade om du har arbetat som konsult


 B3 Business Transformation är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar. Styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder.

title: IT Product Owner
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 We are looking for an IT Product Owner for Compliance. In Product Line Compliance are responsible for both Regulatory and Corporate compliance. We have products and applications that are built in house and also have out of the box solutions. We are looking for a Product Owner who has good product management and technical skills and who can drive the Compliance transformation with various business units to meet the mandatory, regulatory and corporate compliance requirements.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Understanding customer/end-user needs and translate requirements and strategies to meaningful demands and use cases for product development.
* Define and optimize product strategy and roadmap for medium complexity products
* Ensuring non-functional requirements, security, and regulatory compliance of the product according to the rules, guidelines, governance, and applicable processes.
* Set and achieve the Product OKRs and ensure that the Product delivers the expected business value.
* Manage stakeholders and dependencies across organizations.
* Accountable for financial planning, forecasting, budget requests and actuals.
* E2E-accountability for product delivery, including operational responsibility, through the product lifecycle.
* Contribute to commercial discussions together with Sourcing and Suppliers (internal and external)
* Contribute to governance meetings with suppliers and stakeholders


**The Skills You Bring**
* BSc or MSc degree in Computer Engineering or related areas
* 10+ years of proven experience in product and project management
* Experience and understanding of regulatory requirements related to compliance
* Experience from Product Management and/or customer/stakeholder facing roles with strong stakeholder management skills
* Experience in multi-vendor landscape
* Strong communication and presentations skills.
* Strong Technical acumen and ability to adopt emerging technologies
* Proven experience in large-scale implementations
* Familiarity with SAP and non-SAP analytics tools
* Understanding of SAP ecosystem
* Familiarity and experience with AI/ML, Gen AI
* Understanding of trade compliance and compliance requirements


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 768198

title: Operations Technician
description:
**The team, position & mission:** 




 Our Operations Center is at the center of most of what is going on at Digital Services business line of Orange Business. The primary goal for Operation Center is to handle incoming tickets according to the respective process, communicate with customers and involved stakeholders. Troubleshoot and/or escalate incidents and events to ensure that services are back into normal production as fast as possible. Handle standard changes and other predefined changes.
 



  





 In the role as Operations Technician, you will perform day-to-day activities in system and application management for our customers as well as internally. The main task is to ensure 24/7 operations of all systems and respond to tickets and phone calls generated by our monitoring tool and our customers. In Operation Center you will handle and be responsible for a variety of tickets and tasks, such as:
 



  




* User and access management
* Network related changes
* System and application update/upgrades
* Troubleshooting any operational disturbance
* 24/7 on call service



  





 The Swedish Operation Center team consists of 8 experienced Operations Technicians ready to welcome you into a team with a common passion for technology, who always strive to learn more through collaboration and self-studies! Some start in Operation Center after completing relevant IT education at university or vocational education whilst others have a couple of years relevant working experience before joining us.
 



  





 The Operation Center department is a great place to start your journey with Orange Business, Digital Services business line to learn more about our customers and technologies to develop and eventually take the next step in your career internally. Today’s Operations Technicians are our future System Engineers, Technical Account Managers and Cloud Engineers.
 



  





**As an ideal candidate for this position you have:** 



* Relevant work experience within this area, for example a service desk function, NOC, etc and/or relevant IT education at university or vocational education level
* Be comfortable in a server environment, (Linux/Unix and/or Windows)
* Very good verbal and written communication skills in both English and Swedish



  





**It is not a requirement, but other preferred qualifications would be:** 



* Experience of Powershell, Python or similar
* Experience within security and network
* Knowledge of Kubernetes or other container systems



  





**What we offer you:** 



* Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative office in Stockholm
* We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
* An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
* A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
* Read more about the benefits we offer
 
 here
 
 .



  





**About Orange Business:** 




 Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.
 



  





 Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 10 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.
 



  





 With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.
 



  





**The process:** 




 We screen applications on an ongoing basis, with the aim of conducting conversations and interviews as we receive them.
 



  





 Interested but feel that you don´t match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! We believe in the potential of diverse skill sets, perspectives and individuality. We want to encourage everyone to be their authentic selves and your unique capabilities may align perfectly with our team's needs! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!
 



  





 Are you interested to read more about Orange Business? Visit our
 
 Website
 
 or follow our
 
 LinkedIn
 
 account.

title: Systemförvaltare, inriktning sjukvård och operation, till Ersta diakoni
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Ersta diakonis IT-avdelnings förvaltnings- och systemutvecklingsgrupp består idag av fem personer. Gruppen arbetar främst med förvaltning av digitala system och tjänster inom vård- och omsorgsområdet.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär en möjlighet att vara med på en spännande utvecklingsresa och arbeta inom Sveriges största aktör inom idéburen vård och socialt arbete.
   

  

 Som medarbetare hos oss erbjuder vi en rad förmåner som vi hoppas ska ge dig förutsättningar att trivas på jobbet och ha en givande fritid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som systemförvaltare hos oss kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i projekt och operativt förvalta våra system. Du arbetar med hela projektcykeln – från idé till implementation – och hos oss går det snabbt från tanke till verklighet.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* delta i projekt och förvalta system: Arbeta proaktivt och operativt med både utveckling och förvaltning av våra system.
* arbeta nära verksamheten: Samarbeta med våra verksamheter, IT-tekniker, regionala forum och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att våra system möter deras behov.
* ansvara för användarsupport: Ge stöd och service till användare för att säkerställa att systemen fungerar optimalt.
* utföra systemadministration: Säkerställa att våra system är uppdaterade, säkra och anpassade till organisationens behov.


 Ersta diakoni är en mindre organisation, vilket innebär att du får ett brett och varierat arbetsområde där din generalistkompetens kommer till sin rätt.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta brett och varierat inom IT, där du får ta ansvar i projekt och inom systemförvaltning. Du är initiativrik, lösningsorienterad och arbetar gärna operativt.
   

  

 Du är van vid att samarbeta med olika intressenter, både tekniska och verksamhetsnära, och är trygg i att kommunicera och bygga relationer. Att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt i en snabb och dynamisk miljö är något du känner dig bekväm med. Du har förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i olika system och processer.
   

  

 Som person är du strukturerad, analytisk och har ett serviceinriktat förhållningssätt. Du delar Erstas värdegrund om att se hela människan och våra värdeord; professionalism, tillit och hopp.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av arbete inom hälso- och sjukvård
* erfarenhet av operationssystem, inkluisve operationsplaneringssystemet Orbit
* hög förståelse för verksamhetens behov och kompetens att utifrån det formulera krav på IT-stöd
* god kunskap gällande nationella och regionala riktlinjer samt relevanta lagkrav inom Hälso- och sjukvårdslagen och Patientdatalagen.


 Förståelse för tekniska processer såsom integrationer är meriterande.
   

  

**Övrigt om rekryteringen**
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. På grund av semester kommer ha uppehåll i processen från 10:e juli till 8:e augusti.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar provanställning som standard.
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Christian Malmberg, IT-chef, christian.malmberg@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

 Facklig kontaktperson: Fiona Cameron, Vision, Fiona.cameron@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-31
   

  

*Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.*
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Junior Mechanical Verification Engineer
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**
 At Elekta, we make a difference by leading the way in precision radiation therapy. We’re dedicated to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about our mission and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Junior** 
**Mechanical Verification Engineer** 
 to join our R&D team within the Neuro Business Line. You may be a new graduate or have had your first job and are looking for a new opportunity. This position is located at Elekta’s new head office at the heart of
 **Hagastaden in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 You will be a part of a scrum team that specifies, develops and tests products for stereotactic neurosurgery in an R&D organization and works according to the SAFe agile methodology
 **.** 
 The team’s goal is to develop and maintain precise, safe and compliant hardware devices and systems.
   

  

 All mechanics, electronics and software are developed and verified in the Stockholm office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a
 **Junior Mechanical Verification Engineer** 
 at Elekta your primary responsibility will be mechanical verification and continuous test of
 **Leksell Gamma Knife®** 
 and the
 **Leksell® Vantage™ Stereotactic System** 
 (please check the links to check these products you’ll help verify). In short, Leksell Gamma Knife is a non-invasive, precision stereotactic treatment device used to deliver focused radiation to intercranial targets. Leksell® Vantage™ Stereotactic System is minimally invasive system for neurosurgery.
   

  

 You will work in close cooperation with other team members to contribute to:
   

  

* Prototype testing & design improvement: collaborate closely with team members to test prototypes, identify defects, and suggest design enhancements early in the development phase.
* Verification & reporting: write test specifications, execute verification activities, and thoroughly document and report results.
* Process & product improvements: participate in risk analysis, review of requirements, design drawings, related documents and selecting and validating tools.


 This will require that you collaborate with many other stakeholders e.g. within system, control system, mechanics, quality, procurement, and production. We expect you to continuously strive to improve both process efficiency and product quality.
   

  

 At Elekta we are passionate about developing our products, and we need to make sure that our deliveries are of exceptional quality.
   

  

**What You’ll Bring With You**
 We are looking for a highly motivated and quality-oriented team player with a hands-on approach and a passion for innovation. We hope that you are ready to take the initiative, and that you have a structured and analytical approach to solving problems regardless of your level of previous experience. To be successful in the role, we believe you:
   

  

* Have a relevant University education such as Mechanical, Material or Medical Engineering or Physics
* Enjoy working collaboratively in a team to solve problems together
* Appreciate working detail oriented in a structured environment


 If you are curious about agile development, scrum or the SAFe methodology for implementing agile practices that is a benefit.
   

  

**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week).


**Hiring process**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis until the deadline on the
 **30th of June 2025** 
 .
   

  

 For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Agata Antonijczuk at agata.antonijczuk@elekta.com.
   

  

 Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.
   

  

 More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.
   

  

 Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Consultant, Technology Enabled Transformation
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
**About the role:**
 Gartner’s Consulting business is an
 ***extension***
 of Gartner’s industry-leading IT Research. From CIOs, to leaders in business and government, we help Gartner clients across enterprises translate insights into transformational actions and achieve their mission-critical priorities. Leveraging the breadth of Gartner’s resources, Consulting is growing rapidly, with unlimited potential to continue expanding our client base.
   

  

 Technology Strategy Consulting. We help the C-suite make the right decisions based on how technology can transform their businesses. In today’s world, a consulting firm that is “born digital”, (with the ability to directly leverage the full power of Gartner’s research and insights) has relevance to the most important strategic decisions any business will make.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Consultant working at the highest senior levels within our clients’ organizations you will have the opportunity to make a real difference in shaping, managing and delivering real value assisting our clients in successfully managing their technology and defining their IT strategies.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Identify, develop and document issues and recommendations using independent judgment concerning engagement areas being reviewed.
* Conduct research, interviews and presentations for clients (executive and/or board level)
* Assist with the comprehensive cost / benefits analysis and preparation of business cases for technology investments.
* Assist in coordinating and communicating the results of engagements via written reports and oral presentations to client management and key stakeholders
* Contribute to the development of project management, quality assurance and professional consulting and auditing approaches/methodologies.
* Participate in delivery of strategic IT consulting engagements, within a given timeframe and budget, for a variety of clients, which include IT benchmarking and general IT consulting.


**What you’ll need:**
* Diversified strategic IT experience (technology, organization and processes).
* A strong skillset in Architecture or Cloud or Infrastructure or Application development or AI.
* Consulting experience in a similar role in a professional services firm or industry. experience at a strategic or management level.
* Analytical skills.
* Flexibility and adaptability; able to change direction quickly and thoughtfully under changing client needs.
* Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree.
* Excellent project management skills, team work capacity, strong work ethic and willingness to travel and work in a diverse international environment.
* Fluent in Swedish language.
* Swedish security clearable.


**Who you are:**
* Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and spoken
* Ability to articulate IT strategies and understand business strategies
* Comfortable influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives
* Coachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement
* Consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility and a positive outlook in the face of challenges
* Maintain a senior consultant level expertise and currency in industry leading information management technologies
* You will have a natural aptitude for critical and analytical thinking, as well as the capacity to accept out-of-the box solutions


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100549
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Cloudspecialist
description:
Är du en driven och lösningsorienterad tekniker med expertis inom Microsoft Azure? Söker du en ny utmaning där du kan bidra med din tekniska kompetens? Låt Centric hjälpa dig med det! Vi söker personer till flera av våra kunder i Stockholm med minst fem års yrkeserfarenhet inom cloud som trivs med att utveckla en organisations IT-miljö i olika konsultuppdrag.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Som Cloudspecialist kan din vardag se ut på olika sätt. Du kan exempelvis arbeta mot befintliga kunder eller nykund, eller så arbetar du med att stötta kunder genom att implementera, förvalta eller utforma molnlösningar, alternativt så har du ett helhetsansvar för en IT-infrastruktur med fokus på molntjänsterna Microsoft 365 och Azure. Är du inriktad mot AWS eller GCP är du givetvis också av intresse.
   

  

*I denna tjänst kan dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden bestå av att:*
* Designa, implementera och underhålla robusta molnarkitekturer i Microsoft Azure
* Leda migrationer till molnbaserade miljöer
* Ansvara för att dokumentera intern miljö
* Hantera och optimera Azure-miljön inklusive virtuella nätverk, lagringslösningar, databaser och molnresurser
* Upprätthålla bästa praxis för molnlösningar och säkerhet
* Utföra supportärenden som eskalerats till 3rd line
* Automatisera implementeringsprocesser med hjälp av verktyg som till exempel Azure DevOps


**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att du ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna från start ser vi gärna att du har minst fem års yrkeserfarenhet inom liknande arbetsuppgifter, är kundorienterad och trivs med att ge god service och support till användarna. Som person är du ansvarstagande och proaktiv. Du talar och skriver svenska samt engelska obehindrat.
   

  

*Det är ett krav att du har minst fem års erfarenhet av att arbeta med/i:*
* Azure
* Entra
* Intune
* Autopilot


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Treasury Analyst
description:
**About Froda**
 Founded in 2015, Froda’s mission is to democratize access to financing, giving small businesses the same growth opportunities as large ones. Through digital innovation, we’ve transformed the loan process from months to minutes, offering fair, fast, and accessible financing. Now, through embedded lending, we’re integrating our technology with global banks and fintechs, building the next generation of lending infrastructure. Join us in creating opportunities for small businesses to invest in their ideas to the best possible terms.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As part of Froda’s Treasury team, you’ll play a central role in ensuring that we manage our liquidity, financial risks, and capital efficiently to support rapid growth and expansion across markets. In this role, you’ll work broadly across Treasury’s operational responsibilities – including FX management, liquidity planning, and cash management – while also contributing to strategic initiatives and process development. Since we’re a small and agile team, you’ll have the opportunity to take ownership, collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders, and influence the future direction of our treasury function. This is a dynamic role with room to grow, evolve, and make a tangible impact on Froda’s financial foundation and success.
   

  

**In your role you will:**
* Take ownership of day-to-day cash and liquidity management, ensuring efficient flows across accounts and markets
* Lead the execution and continuous development of FX management processes, including hedging strategies and FX liquidity planning
* Support financial risk management initiatives, with a focus on currency and liquidity risk
* Develop and improve cash forecasting models and reporting routines to strengthen forward-looking financial planning
* Drive treasury-related projects and strategic initiatives, often in collaboration with other teams such as Finance, Product, and Data
* Identify and implement improvements and automation opportunities within Treasury processes
* Maintain and refine routines for compliance with regulatory requirements related to liquidity and financial risk
* Contribute to regulatory reporting and ensure operational routines align with applicable liquidity risk related requirements, including monitoring and developing processes in response to new and evolving regulations
* Play an active role in shaping how Treasury supports the business, bringing forward ideas and driving initiatives from concept to implementation


**Who you are:**
* You have 3–5 years of experience in treasury, preferably from a financial institution or fintech
* Hands-on experience in areas such as cash management, liquidity planning, hedging, and/or financial risk management
* You are highly analytical and detail-oriented, with a genuine interest in improving processes and driving operational excellence
* Proficient in Excel and comfortable working with data – experience with SQL or BI tools is a plus
* You thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and enjoy taking initiative and ownership
* You have a strong understanding of financial products and a P&L-driven mindset
* Academic background (BSc or MSc) in finance, business, engineering, or a similar field
* Fluent in both Swedish and English


**What’s in it for you?**
 At Froda, you get the best of both worlds, high energy and fast pace, with the stability to grow long-term. We’re 100+ ambitious self-starters who care about each other and our work. Here, you’ll have the chance to take ownership, grow your skills, and make a real impact. With big ambitions and a fast-evolving business, there’s plenty of room to lead, grow, and be part of something bigger.
   

  

**Furthermore, you’ll get:**
* An opportunity to be part of an exciting journey, shaping the future of our company and transforming the SME financing landscape
* Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
* We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan

title: Head of Growth & Creative
description:
**Wanted: A growth-obsessed, hands-on story-shaper to make Supernormal™ un-ignorable** 




  





 Supernormal isn’t another “wellness” startup with pastel promises.
 



 We’re a Stockholm-born, globally-minded preventative-health company built by the people who turned Klarna into a behemoth, ran Droga5 and its biggest campaigns, and launched cult brands like Arket and CDLP. Our science-backed program reverses metabolic decline, and give people a healthier more vibrant life. We are already growing at rapid pace.
 



  





 Now we need a
 **Head of Growth & Creative** 
 who can turn rocket fuel into roar
 **and personally keep their hands on every lever while they do it** 
 .
 



  





**What you’ll own** 




  




* **Full-funnel alchemy:** 
 architect, design and optimise every digital touchpoint, from first scroll to checkout, squeezing every pixel for conversion gold.
* **Site that seduces:** 
 design, test, and obsess over a website so frictionless it feels like telepathy.
* **Thumb-stopping creative:** 
 concept, script, and ship ads, films, and brand assets that make people ask, “Wait… who
 *are* 
 these guys?”
* **Performance powerhouse:** 
 plan, buy, and scale paid media that prints CAC-efficient growth at warp speed.
* **Words that work:** 
 craft copy, email flows, and texts that flirt, educate, and convert — all before breakfast.
* **Influencer ignition:** 
 DM, brief, and co-create with creators until posts go live.



  




**Who you are** 

  




* Part brand poet, part data sniper, you dream in Pantone
 *and* 
 pivots, and you execute in both.
* Proven headliner: you’ve personally taken DTC or consumer-tech brands from thousands to millions without a bloated agency wall.
* Fluent in the tools: GA, Meta & TikTok Ads, Klaviyo, Figma, Webflow (or your own Swiss-army stack).
* A builder-leader: you inspire a lean, deadly-creative squad
 **by showing rather than telling** 
 .



  




**What’s in it for you** 

  




* **A front-row seat to hypergrowth** 
 with the backing of tier-one creatives and operators.
* **Ownership** 
 : real budgets, real autonomy, real upside, plus the satisfaction of seeing
 *your* 
 work move the curve every week.
* **Impact that matters** 
 : every percentage point you win means healthier, happier humans.
* **Stock options** 
 and a culture as ambitious as it is kind and no corporate bureaucracy to slow you down.



  





 Ready to build a cult brand in health,
 *and* 
 build it with your own two hands?
 



 Apply here and share your portfolio, the biggest metric you personally moved, and one bold idea for Supernormal to tom@supernormal.health.
 



  





**Let’s take normal all the way to Supernormal™**

title: Data Scientist for Corporate Data Insights
job_function: Project Management, Information Technology, and Engineering
company_industry: Banking and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you passionate about information hidden in data, programming, and finance?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Be a part of the Business Steering team in Corporates & Institutions, focusing on the corporate segment in Swedbank’s Business
* Monitor portfolios, perform ‘deep dives’ in large amounts of data using SQL. Assist management and other stakeholders with data driven insights
* Use your skills within programming and statistics to process data
* Through data driven insights help the corporate business to take informed decisions
* Understand how operational processes / policies impact KPIs across a diverse range of disciplines and work with colleagues to show how changing processes / steering can lead to better outcomes


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A creative and problem-solving mindset as well as an ambition to make a difference.
* An interest in the corporate banking business.
* An understanding of the product portfolio within a retail bank.
* Excellent communication skill to be able to convey ideas and analytical results effectively verbally and in writing to a non-technical audience.
* University degree in a technical field such as statistics, mathematics, economics or engineering.
* Practical experience, minimum 2 years, within an analytical framework (e.g. R / Python) and experience using SQL.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 You will work with an agile team, which jointly delivers a wide spectrum of business-critical insights and increase Swedbank’s competitive advantage. We believe in diversity and think it is very important to have an Open and Caring work environment. You will be given responsibility and we will be there to support you!"
 **-Johan Carlberg ,** 
**your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 2025-07-04. We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

**Location: Stockholm City**
**Recruiting manager: Johan Carlberg (+4670 287 55 73)**
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Critical Technician / Elektriker (Datacenter)
description:
**ABOUT CBRE DATA CENTRE SOLUTIONS** 



  


 CBRE Data Centre Solutions (DCS) is a part of the CBRE Group with over 130.000 employees worldwide and delivers fully integrated real estate, facilities and technology solutions for data centre owners, occupiers and investors across the globe. As a dedicated business line within CBRE, DCS is dedicated to solving complex challenges within every stage of the data centre lifecycle.
 


  


 We provide our employees the best conditions to develop professionally and personally and to realise their full potential in the course of their career.
 


  


 Join us now in
 **Stockholm (Sweden)** 
 and bring your unique talent and skills to our Team.
 


  

 Tasks
   


**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES** 



  


 We are looking for a new colleague to our team, at data center in Stockholm. Critical Technicians’ main task is to ensure a good customer delivery by performing service and maintenance on critical/technical equipment and property-related technology equipment with associated web systems, according to the contract and the SLA (Service Level Agreement) and KPI (Key Performance Indicator) that is included in the contract. The role also entitles in-depth technical support and guidance for projects and small works performed on site in both planning, execution, and completion
 


  


***Further Responsibilities***



  

  
* Responding speedily to fault/breakdown requests and efficiently undertaking routine scheduled maintenance of plant and/or equipment
  
* Quality assurance CBRE technical delivery and participate in critical installations and critical maintenance work. Maintain and monitor critical systems
  
* Conduct risk assessments and develop operational procedures
  
* Collaborate with supplier partners and the CBRE team, occasionally liaising with clients
  
* Participate in team activities and carry out additional tasks as required
  
* The main work will be done during office hours; but backfilling the existing
  
* This position requires shift work 24/7 – but is aimed at morning, day and evening shifts but will entail night shifts. In addition, schedule will be adapted to help the team during sick leaves, vacations etc. as the site is operated 24/7
  
* Participate in decisions and the execution of the work
  


  

 Requirements
   


**YOUR QUALIFICATIONS** 



  

  
* Experience within datacenter or other critical environment
  
* Knowledge of building automation systems, cooling systems is a plus, network infrastructure, or in electrical background is strongly meriting
  
* proactive and inquisitive mindset
  
* Good knowledge in English; knowledge of Swedish is advantageous
  
* ESA and AMS is advantageous
  


  

 Benefits
   


**OUR BENEFITS - WHAT YOU´LL GET IN RETURN** 



  

  
* Future-proof job opportunity with a true development guarantee in one of the fastest growing Data Centre markets worldwide
  
* TOP trainings with internationally recognized state-of-the-art certifications
  
* Attractive salaries based on experience and qualification with an annual salary assessment / increase and other good benefits
  
* International working environment with inspiring cross-border career opportunities
  
* Creative working culture with challenging responsibilities and high level of autonomy
  
* DIVERSITY, OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY and WORK-LIFE BALANCE are practiced values!
  


  


***Do you need more good reasons? Please take a look on our recent won awards***



  

  
* Best Data Centre Operator 2025 (Data Centre World Awards)
  
* TOP Company 2025 (among the TOP 5% Employers on KUNUNU)
  
* Outstanding Contribution to Skills and Training Award 2025 (DCS Awards)
  
* Best Places to Work 2024 (Globe St´s)
  
* Best Workplace for Wellbeing (Indeed)
  
* Best Company for Career Growth 2024 (Wallstreet Journal)
  
* Outstanding Contribution to the Data Centre Industry 2024
  
* Commitment to Diversity and Talent Development Award 2024 (Datacloud Global Awards)
  


  


**ARE YOU THE TECHNICIAN WE ARE LOOKING FOR?** 



  


 If yes, please submit your application documents (CV, selected certificates, no cover letter necessary) incl. your availability and the
 ***ref. no. 222673***
 and salary expectations via our application system.
 


  


*CBRE är världens största kommersiella fastighets- och investeringsföretag. På CBRE är vår passion att leverera marknadsledande fastighetsrelaterade tjänster som bidrar till våra kunders framgång! Våra ca 130 000 anställda hjälper investerare, fastighetsägare och hyresgäster över hela världen och omsatte 2023 över 30 miljarder dollar. CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) är ett affärsområde inom CBRE som levererar integrerade tjänster inom fastighetsservice, projekt och rådgivning.*

title: Product Manager
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
**Product Manager**
 As a Product Manager in the PayLater domain, you will play a critical role in shaping how EasyPark serves both end users and business customers through our billing and payment infrastructure. Together with your Engineering Manager, Tech Lead, and a cross-functional team of developers, you’ll be responsible for driving forward the invoicing, B2B ERP integrations, and Direct Debit capabilities, forming the backbone of EasyPark’s billing ecosystem. This system handles millions of recurring and usage-based transactions across Europe and beyond.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about building scalable, compliant, and user-centric financial products in a complex and highly regulated environment, this is your chance to make a major impact.
   

  

**The vision of a PayLater Product Manager**
 Deliver a stable, scalable, and compliant backend integrations to support EasyPark’s consumer and B2B growth across multiple markets
   

  

**The mission of a Product Manager**
* Lead the product strategy and execution for our PayLater and B2B billing experiences, aligning with our mission to provide frictionless, flexible, and future-proof payment solutions to both drivers and business partners.


**Drive Discovery And Strategy**
* Lead product discovery to validate that we’re solving the right problems for both individual users and business customers.
* Deeply understand local market needs (e.g. Direct Debit mandates, invoicing compliance, B2B VAT flows) and adapt the product to meet them.
* Maintain a strong focus on scalability, automation, and compliance throughout all phases of development.


**Own The Product Lifecycle**
* Drive the long-term roadmap for PayLater and B2B billing, balancing operational efficiency, technical resilience, and customer experience.
* Own the retirement or consolidation of legacy payment flows or systems where needed.
* Represent the product in architectural discussions and system evolution.


**Build Strong Internal Partnerships**
* Collaborate closely with Finance, Legal, Risk, and local Market teams to ensure product viability and regulatory alignment.
* Act as the central product point of contact for ERP and accounting integrations.
* Align roadmaps and solutions across the Payments, Platform, and Core domains to ensure smooth data and process flows.


**Deliver And Iterate**
* Maintain a prioritized backlog that balances new functionality, technical debt, and non-functional requirements (NFRs).
* Define clear metrics/KPIs to track product health, adoption, and business impact.
* Apply MVP/MLP thinking to rollout billing and payment capabilities in new markets and segments.


**Empower Your Team**
* Be a strong voice for the product while creating space for the team to own solutions.
* Inspire the team to solve the right problems and foster a strong product-engineering partnership.
* Celebrate learnings – both from successes and failures.


**You’ll Thrive In This Role If You…**
* Have experience with complex billing systems, financial infrastructure, or ERP/payment integrations
* Understand the nuances between consumer and B2B payment needs, and can design products that serve both
* Can balance speed and innovation with reliability and compliance
* Are an excellent communicator, capable of aligning diverse stakeholders and creating clarity from complexity


**Key Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology, or a related field (advanced degree preferred)
* 5+ years of experience in payments or product management, with a focus on digital payment solutions
* Experience working with payment technologies like real-time payments and mobile wallets.
* Strong analytical skills to monitor and optimize product performance
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work across teams and stakeholders
* Experience leading the development of and leveraging APIs for internal and external customers


**About Us**
*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Arkivarie
description:
***Är du arkivarie och vill ha ett meningsfullt och varierande arbete i en samhällsviktig verksamhet? Trivs du med att arbeta med både fysiska och digitala handlingar? Välkommen med din ansökan!***



  


 Vi söker nu en arkivarie till arkivfunktionen som f n består av två arkivarier och en arkivassistent. Arkivarierna ingår i den administrativa avdelningen som även ansvarar för frågor om HR, ekonomi, IT och säkerhet på tingsrätten.
 


  


 Tingsrättens arkiv består av både fysiska och digitala handlingar men även av ett historiskt arkiv från Mark- och miljödomstolen där handlingarna kan vara över 100 år gamla. Det pågår en övergång till ett digitalt e-arkiv och utveckling av nya verktyg som ska stödja den digitala arkiveringen, nya arbetssätt och utlämnande av digital information.
 


  


 Vi finns i moderna lokaler i Sickla, med goda kommunikationer till centrala Stockholm, och lägger stor vikt vid att vara en öppen och modern arbetsplats med engagerade medarbetare. Här kan du läsa mer om Nacka tingsrätt.
 


  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   


 I rollen som arkivarie kvalitetssäkrar du att tingsrättens arkivbestånd lever upp till gällande lagar och förordningar. Du arkivlägger akter i avslutade mål samt ordnar och förtecknar arkivmaterial. Vidare deltar du i utvecklingsarbete och ser löpande över och reviderar myndighetens styr- och rutindokument som till exempel arkivbeskrivningar, gallringsbeslut och andra rutindokument som rör arkivet. I rollen ingår även att utbilda både nyanställda och befintlig personal i arkivfrågor. Därutöver tillhandahåller arkivet tingsrättens allmänna handlingar och det kan periodvis vara stor efterfrågan på dessa. Du och dina kollegor tar emot förfrågningar och expedierar beställningar både via telefon och e-post från allmänhet, myndigheter, parter i mål med flera. 
 


  


 Som arkivarie ingår du också i en regional samverkansgrupp för arkivfrågor där du tillsammans med arkivarier från andra tingsrätter i Stockholmsområdet arbetar med gemensamma frågeställningar.
 


  

 Kvalifikationer
   


**Vi söker dig som har;** 



  

  
* akademisk utbildning om minst 40/60 hp inom arkivvetenskap
  
* erfarenhet av arbete som arkivarie
  
* aktuella och dokumenterade kunskaper i arkiv- och offentlighetslagstiftningen samt Riksarkivets föreskrifter
  
* hög datamognad och ser digitala lösningar som naturliga arbetsverktyg
  
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift, både på svenska och engelska.
  


  


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att i närtid ha arbetat som arkivarie på domstol. Det kan vara meriterande om du har varit del av framtagandet av styrdokument och/eller rutindokument inom arkivområdet och om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med e-arkiv.
 


  

 Personliga egenskaper
   


 Vi söker dig som driver ditt arbete på ett strukturerat sätt. Som person är du positiv, noggrann och trivs med både att arbeta självständigt och med andra. Du trivs med att arbeta med såväl rutinärenden som mer komplicerade frågor. Du har intresse för utveckling, har lätt att anpassa dig vid verksamhetsförändringar och delar gärna med dig av din kompetens i samarbete med andra. Du är en god kommunikatör och har lätt för att anpassa din kommunikation till olika mottagare och sammanhang. Då rollen innebär mycket kontakter, både internt och externt, är det viktigt att du är serviceinriktad och att ditt bemötande är sakligt och opartiskt.
 


  


 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personliga egenskaper.
 


  


 För att bli aktuell för anställning krävs att du motsvarar högt ställda krav gällande omdöme, säkerhetsmedvetande och lämplighet. Det innebär att du står upp för demokratiska värderingar och den statliga värdegrund som styr Sveriges Domstolars verksamhet. Vi ställer krav på att du följer gällande lagar. Innan eventuell anställning genomgår du ett säkerhetssamtal och vi utför registerkontroll.
 


  

 Ansökan
   


 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan, meritförteckning/CV och löneanspråk! Du kommer att få svara på frågor när du fyller i ansökan. Ansök senast: 2025-08-04. 
 


  


 Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta:
 


  

  
* Arja Kimander, administrativ direktör, arja.kimander@dom.se
  
* Meg Goldman, arkivarie, meg.goldmann@dom.se
  
* Marie Vestin, arkivarie, marie.vestin@dom.se
  


  


 Tingsrätten eftersträvar mångfald avseende ålder, kön och kulturell bakgrund. För att säkerställa en inkluderande och rättvis rekryteringsprocess tillämpar Sveriges Domstolar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Vårt urval bygger på kandidaternas kompetenser och meriter. Tester inom personlighet samt problemlösning ingår som urvalsmetod i rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Quality Coordinator
description:
Xylem is a Fortune 500 global water solutions company dedicated to advancing sustainable impact and empowering the people who make water work every day. As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
   

  

 We are seeking an
 **Quality** 
**Coordinator** 
 to play a critical role in driving the work for our certificates in line with company guidelines in collaboration and support of our Nordics Team for project and service activities. It´s a role that is involved in many parts, departments of our business, and many different contacts across our organization, both nationally and internationall
   

  

 As a coordinator, you are expected to work independently but also support and coach our managers and leaders in raising the work environment and ensuring a good safety culture. You will cover various of sites outspread in Sweden making sure our standards and goals are implemented and followed.
   

  

 This role requires 30-40% travel within Sweden.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Maintaining our Integrated Management System(IMS) documentation according to ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 14001:2015 requirements
* Support to aftermarket & sales with ISO related tasks in close collaboration with the Nordics QEHS Manager
* Support implementation of the WI Q and EHS Strategies and targets based on Segment and Corporate demands
* Support the development, establishment and strengthening of the Swedish Integrated Management System (IMS) to include interaction with all departments, ensuring that processes/procedures are properly documented and updated
* Execute the Country Annual Inspection Program to include ISO 9001:2015 & 14001:2015 internal and external audits to include follow-up and closure of related non-conformities, observations, and areas for improvements
* Responsible for completion of the ISO 9001:2015 & 14001:2015 Annual Management Review
* Support the effective implementation of EHS programs and safety campaigns
* Review & update of processes in line with local legal & other requirements


**Qualifications**
* A few years of experience in related field
* ISO 9001:2015 knowledge and experience as Lead Auditor
* Knowledge in updating/maintaining intranet pages
* IT literate to include Microsoft business applications
* Medically fit in order to carry out site audits, visits and inspections
* Skilled in ISO related actions, process writing and evaluation
* Fluent in both Swedish and English both spoken and written
* B driving licens
* ISO 14001:2015 knowledge is beneficial
* Teaching / training qualifications is beneficial


**Characteristics**
 We are looking for a person with good time management skills and quality focus mindset. You’re great at figuring out solutions quickly and effectively, especially when faced with challenges.
   

  

 You are hands-on and you enjoy working in a dynamic work environment. You have a natural ability to engage with others and take charge when needed.
   

  

 We believe you work well with others, listen carefully, and contribute positively to team efforts.
   

  

 You’re always looking for better ways to do things, and you take responsibility for delivering quality results on time.
   

  

**Everyone's equal value**
 We want people, regardless of skin color, age, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity, to feel at home, not just at Xylem, but everywhere in the world. For us, diversity, equality, and inclusion mean more than just a policy or a set of methods. Diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental parts of our corporate culture and a key to long-term growth.
   

  

 Feel free to visit us at https://www.xylem.com/sv-se/
   

  

**Application**
 We look forward to receiving your application in English. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means that we may close the application process if we find the right candidate.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact Recruiter Leila Sayyad, Leila.sayyad@xylem.com.
   

  

 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of inclusion and belonging in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world.

title: Manager Equipment Service (m/f/d)
description:
**The Opportunity**
**The Opportunity**
 Are you a driven, commercially minded leader ready to take on a pivotal role in a dynamic, high-growth environment? At Avantor, we're looking for a
 **Manager Equipment Services** 
 to lead our Technical Services operations across Sweden. Based in Stockholm, you'll report directly to the Director ES Region North and take ownership of driving growth, optimizing service delivery, and developing a high-performing team. This is your chance to lead from the front—implementing best practices, enhancing quality standards, and aligning operations with strategic sales priorities in a business where innovation and service excellence are at the core.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 You are an experienced people leader with a proven track record in technical services and an instinct for commercial success. You have the ability to balance strategic thinking with operational execution and are confident making data-informed decisions in fast-paced, target-driven environments.
   

  

**To Succeed, You Will Need**
* Strong leadership experience in managing technical and administrative teams
* Proven knowledge of technical service environments, ideally with ISO 9001 or ISO 17025 familiarity
* High-level influencing skills and collaborative mindset
* Solid understanding of financial models including labor cost control and third-party service use
* Fluency in both English and Swedish, with a valid driving license
* Ability to work from the Stockholm office 3 days/week, with travel across Sweden


**How You Will Thrive And Make An Impact**
 At Avantor, your leadership will directly influence our success in Sweden. You’ll:
   

  

* Drive profitability by optimizing resources, refining service methodologies, and adopting ABS/TDM tools
* Strengthen collaboration between technical and commercial teams to align service delivery with business goals
* Implement SOPs and elevate quality through best-in-class practices
* Develop your team through mentoring, succession planning, and creating a strong safety culture
* Actively participate in the local leadership team, helping shape the broader strategic direction You’ll manage a team of 5 field-based professionals across Stockholm, Gothenburg, and South Sweden—empowering them to excel while making a measurable difference for our customers and our business.


**Ready to shape the future of technical services with Avantor?** 
 Join us and help deliver mission-critical support that powers science—and fuels progress.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Avantor is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
   

  

**Why Avantor?**
**Dare to go further in your career.** 
 Join our global team of 14,000+ associates whose passion for discovery and determination to overcome challenges relentlessly advances life-changing science.
   

  

**The work we do changes people's lives for the better.** 
 It brings new patient treatments and therapies to market, giving a cancer survivor the chance to walk his daughter down the aisle. It enables medical devices that help a little boy hear his mom's voice for the first time. Outcomes such as these create unlimited opportunities for you to contribute your talents, learn new skills and grow your career at Avantor.
   

  

 We are committed to helping you on this journey through our diverse, equitable and inclusive culture which includes learning experiences to support your career growth and success. At Avantor, dare to go further and see how the impact of your contributions set science in motion to create a better world.
 **Apply today!**
**EEO Statement**
 We are an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
